data.title: Secretary of the Air Force, International Affairs (SAF/IA)
data.meta_description:
Secretary of the Air Force, International Affairs (SAF/IA) | 4,377 followers on LinkedIn. Security Through Cooperation. Following, shares, links, and likes ≠ endorsement. | Secretary of the Air Force, International Affairs (SAF/IA) advances U.S. national security by cultivating deep, enduring relationships through security cooperation with allies and partners in support of the U.S. Air and Space Forces.

As the lead integrator of the Department of the Air Force security cooperation enterprise, SAF/IA oversees and coordinates a wide range of activities to develop mutually beneficial partnerships across the air and space domains.
data.text:
Last week, Assistant SAF/IA Brig. Gen. Ricky Mills and Col. Carey Johnson, chief of SAF/IA’s International Airmen & Guardians division, welcomed newly selected United States Air Force Foreign Area Officers to the career field during the #FAO Orientation at Joint Base Andrews, Md. Over the course of three days, the FAO selects received briefings on regions, upcoming training, and the vital role they will play strengthening relationships with allies and partners. #SecurityThroughCooperation #FAONation

#jobalert Country Director in the Pacific Division, GS-0130-12/13, closes 7 Aug Within SAF/IARP, the country director role reviews, analyzes, and makes recommendations on the political-military, economic, and security assistance aspect of the United States Air Force relations with and interests in the countries in the Indo-Pacific Command (INDOPACOM) area of responsibility. Apply here: https://lnkd.in/eenD_79t

#jobalert Foreign Affairs Specialist and a Branch Chief within the Central Division, GS-0130-14, closes 13 Aug. Leading a team of regional area experts, both military and civilian, to build, sustain and expand relationships in the Central Command (CENTCOM) Area of Responsibility (AOR) on behalf of the Secretary of the Air Force. Apply here: https://lnkd.in/g_ttren5

Last week, United States Space Force Chief of Space Operations Gen. Chance Saltzman, United States Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. Dave Allvin, and Royal Air Force (RAF) Chief of the Air Staff Air Chief Marshal Sir Richard Knighton signed a shared vision statement renewing their services’ commitment to bolstering air and space #integration at the operational and tactical levels. The shared vision is a successive step in a long history of bilateral security cooperation and recognizes the need to rapidly adapt to a changing operational environment. Three critical lines of effort were included to drive continued partnership and support combined responses to shared global security challenges: operational harmonization, capability integration, and system resilience. Read more: https://lnkd.in/edvE2sEk #SecurityThroughCooperation #StrongerTogether #GlobalAirSpaceChiefs U.S. European Command | U.S. Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa

Last week, United States Space Force Chief of Space Operations Gen. Chance Saltzman announced a new addition to the service’s headquarters staff, bringing a member of the United Kingdom’s Royal Air Force (RAF) to the organization. Air Marshal Paul Godfrey took the position in June and will serve the U.S. Space Force as Assistant Chief of Space Operations for Future Concepts and Partnerships after three years as the first commander of UK Space Command. “This is a significant step forward in promoting closer cooperation with an important ally, and it exemplifies the kind of partnership we need to internalize as a service,” Saltzman said in a letter distributed to Guardians. “Air Marshal Godfrey’s integration into a senior service staff is unprecedented, and it pushes the boundaries of what it means to be integrated by design.” Read more: https://lnkd.in/ewFzQTMk #SecurityThroughCooperation #StrongerTogether #PartnerToWin

#jobalert GS-0130-13, SAF/IARC Country Director, closes 23 July Serve as Country Director in the Central Division (Political-Military Affairs Specialist). Reviews, analyzes, and makes recommendations on the political -military, economic, and security assistance aspect of the United States Air Force relations with and interests in the countries in the European Central Command (CENTCOM) area of responsibility. https://lnkd.in/egf7F7_C

**Inter-European Air Forces Academy Welcomes New Commander** The Inter-European Air Forces Academy (IEAFA) held a distinguished change of command ceremony to bid farewell to Lt. Col. Matt Mumm and welcome the new commander, Lt. Col. Lyndsey Banks. Presiding over the ceremony was Col. Dean Berck, Commander of the United States Air Forces in Europe - Air Forces Africa Warfare Center. Lt. Col. Mumm was honored for his exceptional leadership and dedication during his tenure. His contributions significantly advanced the academy’s mission of enhancing cooperation among European and African air forces. Lt. Col. Lyndsey Banks, the incoming commander, brings a wealth of experience and a dynamic vision to the IEAFA. In her address, she expressed her commitment to building on the academy's strong foundation and fostering relationships. Under Lt. Col. Banks’ leadership, IEAFA looks forward to continuing its mission of developing future military leaders and enhancing interoperability. For more photos check our Flickr link below. https://lnkd.in/eVTqHNYi U.S. Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM) Secretary of the Air Force, International Affairs (SAF/IA) #strongertogether #strongereurope #IEAFA

Yesterday, SAF/IA Kelli Seybolt hosted Tunisian Ambassador Hanene Tajouri Bessassi to reaffirm the robust and longstanding security partnership between the United States and #Tunisia. During their meeting, Seybolt commended Tunisia for its regional leadership role, including its efforts in security cooperation and support for United Nations peacekeeping operations. Seybolt also thanked Tunisia for helping to ensure Women, Peace, and Security initiatives were recently integrated into the Association of African Air Forces, a move that will provide a platform to address common challenges women face in their respective services. The leaders additionally discussed the growing partnership between the United States Air Force Academy and Tunisian Air Force Academy, which they agreed will bolster Tunisia’s vision of becoming a training and education hub for African air forces. #SecurityThroughCooperation #StrongerTogether #WPS U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM) | U.S. Air Forces in Europe and Air Forces Africa | Tunisian Air Force (TAF)

This week, SAF/IA welcomed its new deputy, Brig. Gen. Ricky Mills. Mills joins SAF/IA from U.S. Strategic Command, where he served as the director of intelligence. In his role as Assistant SAF/IA, Mills helps to manage approximately 3,600 foreign military sales cases valued at nearly $275 billion and close to 400 cooperative research, development, test and evaluation agreements valued at over $90 billion. Additionally, Mills chairs the Foreign Area Officer developmental team, managing more than 400 U.S. Air Force FAOs serving in over 100 countries, as well as close to 300 military exchange Airmen and Guardians in 40 partner nations. https://lnkd.in/e8WCxKnc #SecurityThroughCooperation United States Department of the Air Force | United States Air Force | United States Space Force
